attributes.action: Install camera’s or speed humps in the new forest to stop animals being killed
attributes.background: There’s been many cases of people speeding and hitting animals which leads to them passing away, we had a young foul have to be put to sleep after a women was speeding and had no care while driving and plowed into the young horse.

rejection.details:
"It's about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for.

Local road safety is the responsibility of your local council. Local roads are managed by Hampshire County Council in Hampshire and Wiltshire Council in Wiltshire. Both councils have their own petitions system:

https://www.hants.gov.uk/aboutthecouncil/haveyoursay/petitions
https://cms.wiltshire.gov.uk/mgGeneric.aspx?MD=Petitions%20Homepage

You could also raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
